EXISTING STRUCTURES
────────────────────────
### Resource Depot & Smelting Facility at base position (x=-4.5, y=18.5)
Consists of:
• Wooden Chest at (x=-4.5, y=18.5) serving as central storage.
• Stone Furnace at (x=-3.0, y=19.0) for iron smelting.
• Stone Furnace at (x=-4.0, y=21.0) for copper plate production.
• Burner Inserter at (x=0.5, y=21.5) with drop at (x=0.5, y=20.5)

### Automation Lab & Steam Power System (Integrated System) at base configuration
Consists of:
• Lab at (x=-7.5, y=18.5) dedicated to automation research; remains in a NO_POWER state despite several connection reattempts.
• Electricity Group comprising:
 – Existing small electric poles at (x=-0.5, y=11.5), (x=-7.5, y=15.5), (x=-4.5, y=15.5), (x=3.5, y=19.5) and (x=1.5, y=22.5);
 – Previously added poles at (x=-7.5, y=16.5) and (x=-8.5, y=13.5);
 – New poles added during recent steps at (x=-10.5, y=18.5), (x=-11.5, y=18.5) and (x=-12.5, y=16.5).
• Steam Engines:
 – Primary steam engine at (x=-13.5, y=16.5) now connected via the pole at (x=-12.5, y=16.5);
 – Additional engines at (x=-14.5, y=13.5), (x=7.5, y=35.5) and (x=8.5, y=20.5).
• Fluid System Submodule – Boiler Module:
 – Pre-existing Boiler at (x=-13.5, y=19.0) and its intermediate pipe at (x=-17.5, y=21.5) (fluid connection failed);
 – Existing new Boiler+Steam Engine Pair comprising a boiler originally placed at (x=-14.0, y=16.5), later repositioned to (x=-10.0, y=22.5), and its associated steam engine at (x=-7.5, y=11.5) (fluid connection unresolved);
 – Additional attempted Boiler+Steam Engine Pair with a new Boiler at (x=-7.0, y=23.5) and a new steam engine at (x=1.5, y=28.5); pipe connection between them remains unresolved.

### Remote Fluid Integration System at remote region (approximate center: x=-30, y=40)
Consists of:
• Offshore Pump at (x=-30.5, y=37.5) operating (WORKING).
• Boiler for fluid heating at (x=-29.0, y=33.5).
• Pipe Connection established via a PipeGroup starting at (x=-30.5, y=31.5) and extending to (x=-30.5, y=34.5).
• New segmented pipe connection attempt to link the Offshore Pump with the New Boiler (targeted at positions near x=-10.0, y=22.5) where candidate segments partially succeeded but overall connection remains unresolved.

────────────────────────
ERROR TIPS
• Electric Pole Placement Conflicts:
 – Ensure the target placement tile is unoccupied. Errors arose when wooden chests, pipes, or transport belts blocked the candidate positions. Adjust spacing, direction, or reference points to find a clear tile.

• Steam Engine Placement and Fueling Errors:
 – Validate that chosen buildable areas are free from water or obstructions before placing steam engines. Several placement attempts failed due to overlapping water or entity footprints.
 – Verify proximity to appropriate fuel-receiving entities when inserting coal; reposition as needed to overcome insertion failures.

• Boiler and Pipe Connection Issues:
 – Pre-calculate buildable areas for boilers and confirm they are unobstructed. Inventory shortages (e.g. missing boilers) must be remedied by crafting before attempting placement.
 – When linking boilers to steam engines via pipes, ensure candidate positions are clear of other entities such as pipes, inserters, or furnaces. Increase spacing or alter directional parameters to avoid collisions.

• Variable Reference Errors:
 – Use correctly defined and consistent variable names. Errors referencing undefined variables (e.g. ‘pole_up’ or ‘pole_from_engine’) indicate the need for careful variable management.

• General Inventory and Buildability Checks:
 – Confirm that required items (such as boilers) are available in the inventory prior to placement attempts.
 – Pre-check buildability of target tiles to avoid obstructions from existing entities or terrain features.
 – Retain previous tips regarding segmented pipe connections, crafting prerequisites, research requirements, movement/positioning constraints, and careful entity retrieval/repositioning, as these remain applicable.
